alert.note: Alert for Methow Valley (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued July 13 at 1:45PM PDT until July 17 at 4:00AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Hot temperatures, Gusty winds and low humidities Sunday and Monday... .Period of hot temperatures, very dry conditions, and gusty winds associated with a dry cold front late this weekend will elevate fire conditions to critical Sunday and Monday. This will increase fire spread for new and exisiting fires. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR METHOW VALLEY... The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Sunday afternoon through late Sunday night. * Affected Area: Fire Weather Zone 704 Methow Valley (Zone 704). * Winds: West 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Relative Humidities: 11 to 18 percent. * Impacts: New and exisiting fires have the potential to spread rapdily within gusty winds and very low humidities.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
